text:
The story behind the iconic Union Jack Dress which Geri Halliwell wore at the BRITs 20 years ago this week- and why it epitomised a pop culture moment Geri Halliwell at The BRIT Awards in 1997 Credit: REX Caroline Leaper , FASHION NEWS AND FEATURES EDITOR 21 February 2017 • 3:54pm 
W hen Geri Halliwell appeared on stage at the 1997 BRIT awards, her ultra-mini Union Jack dress made headlines around the world. But what happened next? 
The designer of Geri Halliwell’s now-iconic Union Jack Dress, first worn at the BRIT Awards 20 years ago, wasn’t a hyper-expensive or exclusive name. In fact, it was the Spice Girl’s sister, Karen, who stitched a flag over the black Gucci minidress that Geri was originally supposed to wear but had deemed ‘boring’. 
The following day, the dress was on the world’s front pages and only a year after she wore it, Halliwell’s dress went on to become one of the most expensive pieces of popstar clothing ever sold at a UK auction. It has been hailed a fashion icon and has earned its place in the pop history books - a rare kind of success that its auctioneer Kerry Taylor explains, is all down to the context of its original wearing.
